Find for tasks matching a specified search word and print it out as a
list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename entire program to brobot
commitResults.messageBody:
The program name and theme is Duke

Duke is the original brownfield project name which is very unoriginal

lets change the program name and messages to fit a new name: Brobot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit readme file with description of brobot
add checkstyle-IDEA plugin and configure plugin with checkstyle.xml file
reformat code to follow checkstyle using checkstyle-IDEA plugin
update build.gradle file to include javafx dependancies
Setup launcher and initialize application for javaFX
add GUI mockup from tutorial
implement broParser into GUI to handle user input and respond correctly
clip display pictures to be a circle
add padding to dialogbox
polish up javadocs comments and modify build.gradle file to use Launcher class as entry point
Refactor UI class functions to be more basic and reusable
commitResults.messageBody:
Most functions in the UI class handle both the string formatting of
the text and printing it.

The GUI does not need to print the text to the terminal, it just needs
the text.

I will separate out the print to Terminal functionality into a separate
function so the main functions will only return the formatted text.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tasklist, Storage and Parser class: Add assertions
commitResults.messageBody:
The above-mentioned classes make unchecked assumptions such as the
taskNUmber being more than 0 and the filePath being writable in storage

Should these criterias not be checked and indeed fail, there could be serious
bugs occuring during runtime.

I will add assertions to check for the assumptions made in Tasklist,
Storage and Parser class to ensure that the program stops if these
assumptions are not met.

commitResults.messageTitle: JUnit Tests: remove unsued test cases and refactor test classes to follow checkStyle
commitResults.messageBody:
There are unused JUnit test classes and the ones that are necessary do
not follow the checkStyle

Resolving these issues will clean up the code and make it more
reader-friendly

I will remove the unused classes and refactor the test cases to follow
checkStyle

commitResults.messageTitle: Separate main Brobot class into BrobotGui and Brobot Cli
Improve code quality in UI class
commitResults.messageBody:
Some functions and variables in the UI class were not reader-friendly

Refactoring the code to be more reader-friendly would improve code
quality.

I will refactor the code to make it more readable.

commitResults.messageTitle: improve code quality in Storage class
improve code quality in classes under task package
Update JUnit tests to to handle new exception messages for brobot
commitResults.messageBody:
The current JUnit tests still test for the exception messages when it
was a Duke program

This change to test the new messages will fix the tests

I will edit the test to ensure it is testing for the correct message

commitResults.messageTitle: update TaskList test to handle exception messages from brobot
Storage command: type 'storage' to change storage directory
commitResults.messageBody:
The current storage directory is fixed to ./data and cannot be changed
by the user.

Allowing the user to change the directory will allow more flexibility
for the user to choose where he/she wants to store their data

I will implement the storage command to open a GUI for which the user
can select their new save directory. The directory will be remembered
even after the application is closed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Clean up code and improve code quality for storage command
commitResults.messageBody:
The current implementation for storage command has missing javadoc
comments and messy code

Cleaning up the code will improve code quality and make it more readable

I will package the storage classes together, clean up unnecessary code
and input the missing javadocs
